meanings.sent1: The keratoid scales on the lizard's skin were tough and protective.
meanings.sent2: Her hair had a keratoid texture, shiny and strong.
meanings.sent3: The keratoid feathers on the bird made it look like a tiny armored warrior.
meanings.sent4: The keratoid shell of the turtle was a shield against predators.
meanings.sent5: The keratoid claws of the cat clicked on the floor as it walked.

meanings.sent1: The keratoid nails were hard and difficult to cut.
meanings.sent2: The keratoid horn of the rhinoceros was a formidable weapon.
meanings.sent3: The keratoid teeth of the shark were sharp and deadly.
meanings.sent4: Her keratoid skin was smooth and resistant to damage.
meanings.sent5: The keratoid beak of the parrot could crack even the toughest nuts.

meanings.sent1: The keratoid cells in the hair follicles provide strength and structure.
meanings.sent2: The keratoid fibers in the wool made it durable and long-lasting.
meanings.sent3: The keratoid statue in the museum was remarkably detailed.
meanings.sent4: The keratoid material of the bird's nest kept the eggs safe and warm.
meanings.sent5: The keratoid composition of the turtle's shell allowed it to withstand heavy blows.
